Subjective: Spot on neck x2 weeks. Initially thought to be a wart, but doesn't resemble one. Scabs have fallen off; swollen and redder after insect bite. Itches; no pain. Meds: None. Negatives: No similar spots elsewhere, no lymph node swelling. Social: Family history of skin problems (actinic keratosis, squamous cell carcinoma, basal cell carcinoma). ICE (Concern): Worried about skin cancer.
Objective: Neck: 0.5cm raised, pinkish-red spot with redder center. Flaking/scabbing. No lymph node swelling.
Assessment: Possible pyogenic granuloma or atypical mole. Ruled out: Melanoma.
Plan: 1. E-consultation with dermatologist. 2. Patient to receive call with advice on Friday. 3. Possible removal methods: freezing with liquid nitrogen, excision with skin sample, or scraping device with tissue analysis. 4. Patient prefers freezing method. 5. Follow-up appointment to discuss knee pain.
